required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of PBM on Functional Capacity and Fatigability in Post Covid-19 Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study Between Photobiomodulation and Placebo on Functional Capacity and Fatigability in Post Covid-19 Elderly

brief_summary.textblock: Participants had randomly divided into two equal groups. Group (A) which is the study group will receive photobiomodulation session two times per week for four weeks. Group (B) will be the control group that will receive placebo photobiomodulation two times per week for four weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
group (A):
1. Each participant will sign a consent form after receiving a detailed explanation about the procedure.
2. submaximal exercise capacity using time up and go test will be assessed.
3. fatigability will be assessed using fatigue assessment scale.
4. hemodynamic variables including; Blood pressure, heart rate, oxygen saturation, maximum oxygen consumption will also be assessed.
5. After one month all the assessment procedure will be repeated again.
r group (B):
1. Each participant will sign a consent form after receiving a detailed explanation about the procedure.
2. submaximal exercise capacity using time up and go test will be assessed.
3. fatigability will be assessed using fatigue assessment scale.
4. hemodynamic variables including; Blood pressure, heart rate, oxygen saturation, maximum oxygen consumption will also be assessed.
5. After one month all the assessment procedure will be repeated again.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: participants will divided into two equal groups , group A will receive photobiomodulation sessions and group B will receive placebo photobiomodulation

primary_outcome.measure: effect of photobiomodulation on fatigability level
primary_outcome.time_frame: after one month of the trial application
primary_outcome.description: fatigability level will be assessed using fatigability assesment scale

primary_outcome.measure: effect of photobiomodulation on functional capacity level
primary_outcome.time_frame: after one month of the trial application
primary_outcome.description: functional capacity state will be assessed using submaximal exercise test (time up and go test)

arm_group.description: the participant will received photobiomodulation session.
the participant will received placebo photobiomodulation session.

intervention.description: Photobiomodulation (PBM) describes the use of red or near-infrared light to stimulate, heal, regenerate, and protect tissue that has either been injured, is degenerating, or else is at risk of dying.
placebo intervention while the photobiomodulation device is on the off mode

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 60 to 75 years of age
- past history of covid 19 in the last year
Exclusion Criteria:
- ( history of a histologically demonstrated malignant carcinoma , hyperthyreosis , epilepsy, light sensitivity )

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of physical therapy at Cairo University

responsible_party.investigator_title: lecturer at faculty of physical therapy at Cairo University
